bow: maternity leave with one month old few days into maternity leave with my one month old first and only child and feel like should be loving it but finding it so hard already love my daughter but feel like have no identity and ca do anything would do to keep developing any other part of myself she wants to eat every hour and half during the day and afterwards if put her anywhere she fusses and fusses and fusses scream cries so have to be holding her or carrying her which does always work either or if can get her down and sleeping she might sleep for ten minutes and then wake up and fuss ica clean ca really read ca write writing is my big passion can barely even keep myself fed because she starts crying in the time it takes to make toast plus almost every time feed her she spits up afterwards even if she ate an hour ago small frequent feedings or if she upright feel like she gross and gross and ca keep us clean and happy at all have no family in the area so by the afternoon feel totally trapped and counting down the hours until my husband gets home what works one day to make her happy does work the next day think understand her cues but then guess wrong how does anyone do this and not go crazy that sounds so hard you re doing awesome keeping her alive go mama the first weeks are about survival for everyone forget about cleaning consider premade food for all meals everything you re saying is normal you re not alone enjoying maternity leave comes later for some never for others tiny babies are hard most get better at some point and some start smiling by weeks that helps one thing that helped me the most is local mom support group it run out of the hospital it free and it is hosted by lactation consultant you might consider something like that so you can share your struggles and find solace with others that have the same daily challenges lastly ppd ppa is real so keep an eye on your feelings and talk about them get medical help if you need it feel for you the challenge is real and the pain is temporary babies change all the time so do get stuck thinking it will be like this forever you can pm me if you need any support or help finding something in your area hugs from another mama it gets better around no when they start smiling and laughing even better around no when they start crawling and playing with toys and super awesome around year when they start walking hang in there every month is easier than the last found the first months so hard my husband was even home for the first five weeks and it was the most difficult thing have ever done there was no routine did understand what was doing at all plus was breastfeeding and that was nightmare which we finally managed to get right after about months honestly it gets so much easier as they get older months was such huge turning point for us hang in there if there are any new mum groups near you or story time at the library or playgroups suggest you give them try getting out of the house can help lot plus you can get support or friendly ear mine is two months and it will probably get easier check into reflux learning more about it will help my first need zantac before he quit crying like that plus he started gaining weight after that breastfeeding my 3rd and got ta say you might have to make food log to figure out if it something you re eating my babies did do not like eggs or mcdonalds chicken nuggets weird know try to steer clear and it helps lot colic is also thing there are so many reasons babies cry you ll drive yourself crazy trying to figure it out as long as you ve offered the breast and changed their diaper there is much to do besides hold them sometimes babies wear themselves out crying and then guess what they do after that cry more do get me wrong definitely end up holding my little one pretty much all the time invest in good baby carrier have the boba wrap and love it those days when they re fussy put them in the wrap to get peace make sure you monitor her weight gain and check in with your pediatrician regularly they might have good advice for you concerning colic growth spurts cluster feeding reflux etc breastfed babies imo cry more and want to be held 24 do listen to people telling you you ll spoil her worry about that when she hits about months and it could actually be the issue at one month they cry because they need comfort or something is wrong hungry etc this may sound crazy but learned it from my first baby and it works breastfed babies do always burp easily sit them upright against me support their head and just wait few minutes lot of times they will burp on their own or sometimes have to do few gentle baby sit ups where lay her back and then sit her up again and burp will work itself out know it sounds crazy but it changed my life would sit there and burp my first on my shoulder for 20 minutes and get nothing and then he would spit up because he had air in his belly my oldest was tough as baby he never stopped crying ever until about weeks lol you ll get through it mama ps if you need to see picture to see what talking about with the burping thing pm me and will have someone take pic to send you removed what you describe is basically what every new parent has to go through know you re not alone at all in this situation or your feelings of stress this is the throes of new baby time and it tough especially if you ve got bit of fussy one which your little guy sounds like poor thing it will all get better soon hang on to that truth what helped me the most was grabbing baby carrier and just getting out of the house lot just go about your day doing the things you like to do and bring baby along wan na make toast make toast wan na go to the park museum store just go yes there will be some screams and tears sometimes from both of you at the same time but you will feel ton better with some freedom also babies are incredibly sensitive to our stress and feel it it crazy how my babies would just get crankier the days felt particularly nuts with stress another tip don give up after the first few times venturing out which will almost always be semi disastrous it takes practice for the both of you to get used to this way of getting around stick to it and it will work out the biggest stressor for me as new mom besides sleep deprivation was feeling trapped and stressed hours on end waiting for naps and the next feed it ugly good luck and remember it will get better feel you my daughter is six weeks by monday and it is basically the same am just not into writing that much it is hard to satisfy this little girl but believe in others it must get better soon it must yeah it is hard being sleep deprived trying to figure out my little one is one of the hardest thing ive had to do only light is love her so much but yeah definitely hard work and dont know for you but it often seems am the only one who cares my husband loves her clearly but even when he is home he doesnt help that much or he helps but looks pissed he has to anyway find that what helps me the most is getting out little every day have baby wrap which saved my life especially since she needs to be on me really often and can not stand being alone unless it is on her baby swing bought it used and sometimes she will fall asleep or at least she tolerates being left there 10 15 minutes hang in there you are not alone and are doing an amazing job keeping your little one alive we are all doing our best which is truly the only thing we can do so dont guilt yourself trust it will get easier spent the first of my weeks of maternity leave bawling and really regretting our decision to have baby it was harder than anything ve had to do so far but you get through it newborns are fucking hard man you got this hi ❤️ have 14 month old and his early months sounded just like yours —i could have written your post know everyone says no screen time but the only thing that got me through those long spit up full days was watching tons of netflix the office food network and what not to wear while sat on the couch feeding and holding baby while he refused to nap we have no family nearby so get how hard that is going for walks with the stroller or baby carrier also help lot check out storytime at the local library or mom groups find your tribe all of this to say you re not alone hang in there it gets easier though not ever necessarily easy find small ways to feel like yourself or find joy during the day pm anytime here for you normal one thing that helped me was getting wrap or sling and wearing her could at least use my hands then if you need help resources check out local babywearing group on facebook they usually rent them and can show you how to use them take friend or dad top the meeting and learn how together you might be too tired to remember it all it really sounds like reflux log her sleeping eating and see your pediatrician my first had reflux and by weeks he was barely sleeping and losing weight and that when we knew something was wrong clingy babies aside you do want to wait because it ll just get worse give yourself some grace my daughter is months old right now and so much fun but really really did not enjoy myself the first 10 weeks of her life was in complete survival mode it totally okay not to like this phase and you will get through it and you will probably enjoy this whole parenting thing don judge yourself or your baby on the first few months the first few months are sometimes referred to as the fourth trimester they are so needy and can barely be separated from you it is rough it is thankless it is insanity inducing but it is also finite there is an end every day you go through like this is one less you will have to do in the future celebrate the end of every day or every rough night because you made it through one more do know if that helps you but that thought of that one fewer sleepless night ll have to do in the future helped me in the rough times get baby carrier mine never slept except on person so just wore her almost all the time either me or my husband ate lot of meals over my baby head while she was in carrier with burp cloth draped gently over her head to catch crumbs being careful to leave room for air to get in white noise get white noise app on your phone or buy one of those standalone white noise machines my newborn slept so much sounder with white noise going and if you can do it safely cosleeping saved my life read up on how to safely cosleep do do it if you ve been drinking or smoking make sure you have safe mattress etc slept on mattress on the floor for while especially if you re breastfeeding cosleeping is amazing you sleep better the kid sleeps better if they wake up to feed you just roll over whip out the boob do even have to lift your head from the pillow zone while they feed then tuck it all back in and go back to sleep when you re done because you do fully wake up while you re feeding you can get back to your sleep cycle easier and get more rest overall everyone does go crazy eventually it gets easier for me that was about the month mark you are definitely not alone my daughter is and some days truly wonder if am fit to be her mom she was born with congenital heart defects and had open heart surgery when she was 10 days old was terrified when we finally brought her home because every single time fed her the special formula they sent home with us she would choke turn blue and stop breathing until could suck everything out of her throat with one of those booger sucker things was terrified being alone with her she had reflux really bad once she started regular formula but zantac helped her so much always hated when other moms said it would get easier but here am telling you it really does you get used to the routines and the mess and the clinging and everything in between mom guilt sucks so bad you feel like you are shell of your former self and this little person that you are supposed to love unconditionally is literally sucking the life out of you it is somewhat comforting for me at least to know that what you are feeling right now is completely normal hang in there you ve got this hi mom of and year old here as well as nicu nurse what you re describing sounds like your baby has reflux would speak to your physician about it if she on formula there are better formulas for reflux if you re breastfeeding the only real option is medication she is likely eating every hour and half because she is waking up with reflux and sucking is what soothes her but since her stomach hasn had chance to fully empty it gets even more full and she reflexes more it vicious cycle but understand it hard to stretch out the time between feeds when you have screaming baby if you haven incorporated pacifier at this point would recommend it to satisfy her urge to suck for self soothing would also keep her upright for 30 60 minutes after each feed to aid in digestion the little baby bouncy seats or swings are great for this you can also try wearing her with soft infant carrier or wrap of some sort this will keep her upright keep your hands free and allow her good nap all this being said sometimes you can try million things and they still cry that doesn mean you did anything wrong it the only way babies know how to communicate allow yourself to eat and shower while she cries it is not harmful for an infant to cry for 10 20 minutes or longer it harder on us mommas than it is on the babies promise same with spit up if they re gaining weight spitting up isn harmful just messy everything with babies is phase but they do become more consistent and predictable around months know this doesn help today but want to offer you that hope some of these things messy house messy clothes less time for yourself are part of parenthood that you will adapt too it very overwhelming right now and that exacerbated by lack of sleep it will get better everyone is going to have their opinions at the end of the day you have to decide what best for you and your family be confident in your decisions and take the advice you like and leave the rest lastly make sure you re checking in with your practitioner about your own mental health if you re too overwhelmed to function properly please don be afraid to reach out to them to get help hope some of this helped at least feel free to ask any questions you are doing great job babies are hard work breastfeeding is hard at first and not sleeping sucks it not fun right now but it does get better everyone told me that and it was hard to believe at the time but it true didnt start having fun until my son smiled at me for the first time try to get out of the house and go for walk or just go walk around target you do need to buy anything but always do anyway talk to your spouse or someone about how you are feeling because it does help if these feelings dont get better start talking to your doctor about postpartum depression one thing will say is that pretty much all babies have reflux their gi system is not mature and it results in spitting up it can also be exacerbated by an over supply or and overactive letdown it eventually does lessen and then goes away around months if she is screaming arching her back after feeds or seems uncomfortable definitely talk to her pedatrician about meds otherwise try to have lots of burp cloths around and change your shirt and her clothes often just wan na say hang in there mama like others have said these feelings are normal at one month your baby is still getting used to life outside the womb and even for veteran mothers you are still learning each others cues it gets easier in lot of ways and in few months you will see more of your child personality they won be total blobs of need your doing such great job currently on my third youngest months and if had to give one thing of advice it would be this too shall pass for real it does with my first born felt the same way he had acid reflux which added more stress to the situation with my second decided to go with the flow and forget about trying to do stuff around the house but enjoy the maternity leave instead during the night would put the baby in bassinet near my bed so do have to stand up and go to her crib during the day would nurse her to sleep and then place her on my chest on her tummy for nap she slept for hours that way while browesed internet on my phone or read books or watch tv shows she would never sleep more then 20 minutes otherwise after long nap the baby was very calm and happy which made me happy did have much time to cook or clean the house only was able to do stuff when she was awake but was happy and enjoyed the time that all sounds so familiar promise it will get better they do need you every hour forever remember around that age started taking my lo to story times at the library and that was lifesaver could get out of the house entertain my lo and pick up some new movies or something for myself to do while he was feeding all at the same time have an month old and can remember all of this like ot was yesterday the first months were so hard just keep telling yourself that it will pass cried so much out of frustration but then it got way easier google the 4th trimester it helps make you more sympathetic to what your baby is going through right now good luck it ok if the baby cries while you do something for yourself for few minutes find local babywearing group the newborn stage is tough as new mom find local group to help you learn how to use wrap or carrier to wear your baby so you can get stuff done go to target or go get coffee tea whatever and wear the baby to get out of the house and walk around to do something for you you ve got this mama hang in there promise you it gets better first six weeks were hard and like other posters had my husband with me for the first five breastfeedimg is so difficult and painful because both you and bubs are learning to latch etc and everything is sore at the 15 week mark now and it has gotten better and better she sleeps longer at night though not through the night and we get smiles and sounds like coos and babbles which are really rewarding hang in there this used wrap the stretchy type like solly baby wrap and it means you can wander around the house or get outside bubs seem to love it as it feels warm and cosy for them like they re inside the womb you got this it only gets better that what keep telling myself when there are bad days know it lot for right now but very early on they re much more needy they are sensitive to everything and being around mom is the only thing that is soothing would try to get sling or boba wrap so you can be hands free and keep her upright after certain period you would even be able to feed in it if you continue to feel the way you do would talk to your husband and doctor just keep pushing mama remember it gets better you ll be able to give you bit more freedom it sounds like she might have bit of reflux go to the drs and get her checked out there are anti reflux powders for infants have to use it for my youngest and it fantastic when you go from changing their clothes times day to once or twice it also means she ll settle for long because her tummy is staying full you are still in the really difficult part she is still new born you ve got another weeks of this eventually she will settle and you will be able to reclaim little time for yourself know how you feel started carrying my son in sling and still do now that he is
